definitions.definition: Able to be measured using a common standard .
examples: A yard and a foot are commensurable , as both may be measured by inches.

definitions.definition: Related in size or scale ; commensurate or proportionate .

examples: The numbers 12 and 18 are commensurable , as both are divisible by 6, while 12 and 19 are incommensurable.

main_definition: Able to be measured using a common standard .
secondary_definitions: Related in size or scale ; commensurate or proportionate .
( mathematics ) ( of two or more numbers ) Divisible by the same number
